GOVERN.description: Establish cybersecurity governance and risk management strategy

subcategories.GV.SC-01: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
subcategories.GV.SC-02: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and partners are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally
subcategories.GV.SC-03: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management is integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and improvement processes
subcategories.GV.SC-04: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality
subcategories.GV.SC-05: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and other types of agreements with suppliers and other relevant third parties
subcategories.GV.SC-06: Planning and due diligence are performed to reduce risks before entering into formal supplier or other third-party relationships
subcategories.GV.SC-07: The risks posed by a supplier, their products, or their services are understood, recorded, prioritized, assessed, responded to, and monitored over the course of the relationship
subcategories.GV.SC-08: Relevant suppliers and other third parties are included in incident planning, response, and recovery activities
subcategories.GV.SC-09: Supply chain security practices are integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management programs, and their performance is monitored throughout the technology product and service life cycle
subcategories.GV.SC-10: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management plans include provisions for activities that occur during and after incidents

subcategories.ID.RA-01: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented
subcategories.ID.RA-02: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources
subcategories.ID.RA-03: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented
subcategories.ID.RA-04: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified
subcategories.ID.RA-05: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform risk response prioritization
subcategories.ID.RA-06: Risk responses are identified and prioritized
subcategories.ID.RA-07: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked
subcategories.ID.RA-08: Processes for receiving, analyzing, and responding to vulnerability disclosures are established
subcategories.ID.RA-09: The authenticity and integrity of hardware and software are assessed prior to acquisition and use
subcategories.ID.RA-10: Critical suppliers are assessed prior to acquisition and during use

PROTECT.description: Implement safeguards to ensure delivery of critical infrastructure services

subcategories.PR.DS-03: Systems/assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition
subcategories.PR.DS-04: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained
subcategories.PR.DS-05: Protections against data leaks are implemented
subcategories.PR.DS-06: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity
subcategories.PR.DS-07: The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment
subcategories.PR.DS-08: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity
subcategories.PR.DS-09: Managing the security of data throughout its lifecycle including during aggregation, processing, and sharing
subcategories.PR.DS-10: Data security roles and responsibilities are established
subcategories.PR.DS-11: Data is destroyed according to policy

subcategories.DE.CM-01: Networks and network services are monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
subcategories.DE.CM-02: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
subcategories.DE.CM-03: Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
subcategories.DE.CM-06: External service provider activities are monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
subcategories.DE.CM-07: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed
subcategories.DE.CM-09: Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their configurations are monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

RESPOND.description: Take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident

subcategories.RS.AN-01: Notifications from detection systems are investigated
subcategories.RS.AN-02: The impact of the incident is understood
subcategories.RS.AN-04: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans
subcategories.RS.AN-05: Processes are established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources
subcategories.RS.AN-06: Actions performed during an investigation are recorded
subcategories.RS.AN-07: Incident data and metadata are collected and preserved

RECOVER.description: Restore capabilities or services that were impaired due to a cybersecurity incident

subcategories.RC.RP-01: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process
subcategories.RC.RP-02: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed
subcategories.RC.RP-03: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration
subcategories.RC.RP-04: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms
subcategories.RC.RP-05: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operating status is confirmed
subcategories.RC.RP-06: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria established by the organization
